item.title: Dover Demon
item.description:
Dover Demon ðŸ”—

The Dover Demon is a cryptid reportedly sighted in Dover, Massachusetts, in April 1977.

Sightings ðŸ”—

This section details the reported sightings of the Dover Demon in April 1977. William “Bill” Bartlett, John Baxter, and Abby Brabham, all teenagers at the time, independently reported seeing a strange creature. Bartlett described it as a 4-foot tall creature with glowing orange eyes, a watermelon-shaped head, and no nose or mouth, seen on Farm Street in Dover. Baxter reported a similar sighting on Miller Hill Road, and Brabham claimed to have seen the creature on Springdale Avenue the following night. The teenagers drew sketches of the creature, with Bartlett swearing on a stack of Bibles to the accuracy of his depiction. The locations of the sightings, when plotted on a map, formed a straight line over 2 miles. The sightings became public in May 1977, and a local investigator noted similarities to the creatures in the Kellyâ€“Hopkinsville encounter. The Mutual UFO Network also investigated the sightings.

Possible explanations ðŸ”—

This section explores potential explanations for the Dover Demon sightings. One suggestion is that the creature was a foal or a moose calf. Skeptic Joe Nickell proposes that the creature was likely a snowy owl, citing its size and plumage, which could reflect yellow headlights as the peach color described by Bartlett. He also suggests that the creature’s “long spindly arms” could be the partially opened wings of a snowy owl. Police suggested the sightings were a school vacation hoax. Skeptic Ben Radford suggests the sightings may have been influenced by the release of Star Wars and Close Encounters of the Third Kind in 1977.

In popular culture ðŸ”—

This section outlines the Dover Demon’s appearances in popular culture. In 2009, it was featured in an episode of the television series Lost Tapes on Animal Planet. The Dover Demon appears as a character in the comic book series Proof and The Perhapanauts, as well as in The Pound: Ghouls Night Out and Hack/Slash: Entry Wound. It also appears in the webcomic Gunnerkrigg Court. Additionally, an alien known as Dover Demon appears in the manga series Dandadan.

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dover_Demon
